clinical_study.brief_title: Data Collection of Routine Clinical Use With the Spectra Optia® Apheresis System for White Blood Cell Depletion
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Retrospective Data Collection of Routine Clinical Use With the Spectra Optia® Apheresis System for White Blood Cell Depletion

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multicenter, retrospective data collection of routine clinical use with the Spectra Optia® apheresis system for white blood cell depletion.

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of this study is to gather a broader knowledge and information from routine clinical use on the performance and safety of white blood cell depletion procedures with the Spectra Optia® apheresis system.
In order to do so, retrospective data on white blood cell depletion procedures with the Spectra Optia® apheresis system done in routine use in 3 different centers will be collected and analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Decrease in White Blood Cell Count in Patient Following Apheresis Procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after apheresis procedure: on average this will be within 15 minutes after the end of the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Percent decrease in WBC count calculation: (WBCpre - WBCpost) / WBCpre x 100%

primary_outcome.measure: Collection Efficiency (CE) for WBC (or Percent of Processed WBCs) Achieved by Spectra Optia.
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after apheresis procedure: on average this will be within 15 minutes after the end of the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Collection efficiency for WBC achieved by Spectra Optia System calculation: (WBC/µL depletion product x depletion product volume) / (WBCpre + WBCpost) / 2 x total processed blood volume)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 24 hours after the procedure.
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events were defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medical device, whether or not considered related to the medical device and/or procedure. Therefore, an AE could have been any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of the medical device and/or procedure.

other_outcome.time_frame: Prior to Each Spectra Optia Apheresis Procedure
Prior to Each Spectra Optia Apheresis Procedure
Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 2 hours after the procedure, an average of 6 hours.
Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 2 hours after the procedure, an average of 6 hours.
other_outcome.description: Volume of patient's blood processed in mL during the apheresis procedure

other_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 2 hours after the procedure, an average of 6 hours.
other_outcome.description: Whole Blood Flow in mL/min measured during the white blood cell depletion procedure

other_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 2 hours after the procedure, an average of 6 hours.
other_outcome.description: The duration of the WBCD procedure measured in minutes

other_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 2 hours after the procedure, an average of 6 hours.
other_outcome.description: % change in patient's pre and post-depletion procedure platelet counts

other_outcome.time_frame: Post each Spectra Optia Apheresis Procedure

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have undergone white blood cell depletion via the Spectra Optia Apheresis System which is likely to include patients with severe leukocytosis in acute leukemia (acute myeloid leukemia, acute lymphoblastic leukemia, or in chronic myelogenous leukemia) or to prevent tumor lysis syndrome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients having received a minimum of 1 white blood cell depletion procedure via the Spectra Optia Apheresis System
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

facility.name: Institute for Transfusion Medicine and Immunohaematology, German Red Cross Blood Donor Service Baden-Württemberg-Hessen gGmbH, Johann-Wolfgang-Goethe-University Hospital
Szent Istvan and Szent Laszlo Hospital of Budapest

group.title: Subjects Who Received a Minimum of 1 WBCD Procedure
group.description: Eligible subjects had received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System

participants_list.participants: Data were collected from 58 WBCD procedures performed in 43 subjects - Full and Safety Analysis Sets
The Per-protocol Analysis Set comprised 54 procedures performed in 41 subjects
2 of 3 study sites collected additional safety data; 32 pts. 0-24 hour data, 43 pts. 0-2 hour data

baseline.population: Eligible subjects had received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System.

group.title: Subjects Who Received At Least 1 WBCD Apheresis Procedure
group.description: Eligible subjects who received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Percent Decrease in White Blood Cell Count in Patient Following Apheresis Procedure
outcome.description: Percent decrease in WBC count calculation: (WBCpre - WBCpost) / WBCpre x 100%
outcome.time_frame: immediately after apheresis procedure: on average this will be within 15 minutes after the end of the procedure
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set comprised all 43 patients (58 procedures) for whom WBCD data were collected. One patient terminated the first procedure prematurely and therefore did not have post-procedure data, resulting in a total of 57 units analyzed.

group.title: WBCD Procedures Performed
group.description: Eligible subjects received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System; 58 WBCD procedures were performed in 43 patients

measure.title: Percent Decrease in White Blood Cell Count in Patient Following Apheresis Procedure
measure.description: Percent decrease in WBC count calculation: (WBCpre - WBCpost) / WBCpre x 100%
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set comprised all 43 patients (58 procedures) for whom WBCD data were collected. One patient terminated the first procedure prematurely and therefore did not have post-procedure data, resulting in a total of 57 units analyzed.

outcome.title: Collection Efficiency (CE) for WBC (or Percent of Processed WBCs) Achieved by Spectra Optia.
outcome.description: Collection efficiency for WBC achieved by Spectra Optia System calculation: (WBC/µL depletion product x depletion product volume) / (WBCpre + WBCpost) / 2 x total processed blood volume)
outcome.time_frame: immediately after apheresis procedure: on average this will be within 15 minutes after the end of the procedure
outcome.population: The CE of the WBCD procedures was measured from the waste bag (depletion product) contents from Sites 2 and 3. WBC counts were not available from the waste bags for subjects treated at Site 1.

group.title: WBCD Procedures Performed
group.description: Eligible subjects received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System; 58 WBCD procedures were performed in 43 patients

measure.title: Collection Efficiency (CE) for WBC (or Percent of Processed WBCs) Achieved by Spectra Optia.
measure.description: Collection efficiency for WBC achieved by Spectra Optia System calculation: (WBC/µL depletion product x depletion product volume) / (WBCpre + WBCpost) / 2 x total processed blood volume)
measure.population: The CE of the WBCD procedures was measured from the waste bag (depletion product) contents from Sites 2 and 3. WBC counts were not available from the waste bags for subjects treated at Site 1.

outcome.title: Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse events were defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medical device, whether or not considered related to the medical device and/or procedure. Therefore, an AE could have been any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of the medical device and/or procedure.
outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for the duration of the procedure and for up to 24 hours after the procedure.
outcome.population: Full and Safety Analysis Sets. 53.5% of subjects with acute myeloid leukemia (AML), 18.6% of subjects with chronic lymphocytic leukemia, < 10% of subjects with other diagnoses. The WBCD procedure was performed most frequently to treat leukocytosis (44.2%), to prevent tumor lysis syndrome (34.9%), or to treat increased blood viscosity (20.9%).

group.title: Safety Data Collection 0-2 Hours Post Apheresis Procedure
group.description: 58 WBCD procedures were performed in 43 patients. Safety data was collected for up to 2 hours post apheresis procedure

group.title: Safety Data Collection 0-24 Hours Post Apheresis Procedure
group.description: 41 WBCD procedures were performed in 32 patients. Safety data was collected for up to 24 hours post apheresis procedure

measure.title: Adverse Events
measure.description: Adverse events were defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medical device, whether or not considered related to the medical device and/or procedure. Therefore, an AE could have been any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of the medical device and/or procedure.
measure.population: Full and Safety Analysis Sets. 53.5% of subjects with acute myeloid leukemia (AML), 18.6% of subjects with chronic lymphocytic leukemia, < 10% of subjects with other diagnoses. The WBCD procedure was performed most frequently to treat leukocytosis (44.2%), to prevent tumor lysis syndrome (34.9%), or to treat increased blood viscosity (20.9%).
measure.units: Number of subjects with at least 1 TEAE

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data (including serious adverse events [SAEs]) were collected from the time of the start of the WBCD procedure through 2 hours post-procedure for 43 patients and 58 procedures. Adverse event data (including serious adverse events [SAEs]) were collected from the time of the start of the WBCD procedure through 24 hours post-procedure for 32 patients and 41 procedures.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), version 4.03, and coded using the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA®, version 17.0).

group.title: 0-2 Hour Safety Data Collection
group.description: Eligible subjects had received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System; safety data collected for 2 hours post apheresis procedure

group.title: 0-24 Hour Safety Data Collection
group.description: Eligible subjects had received a minimum of 1 WBCD procedure using the Spectra Optia Apheresis System; safety data collected for 24 hours post apheresis procedure

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Study Site reserves the right to publish the results of its work on the Study. The timing of publication however shall not exceed the 6 months after completion of the Study. Study Site and the PI agree to submit copies of any manuscript/abstract proposed for publication to Sponsor at least 30 days in advance of the presentation. Sponsor may require the delay of publication for no longer than 90 days for the purpose of filing patent applications.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Isobelle Galeon, MD, MPH, MSCS, Medical Monitor Clinical Safety
